intro: Antirrhinum commune, commonly known as the common snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that resemble a dragon's mouth. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Antirrhinum commune is also popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
